alert.note: Alert for Mendocino Coast; Northwestern Mendocino Interior (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 06 at 1:36PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN MENDOCINO COUNTY THROUGH 215 PM PST... At 134 PM PST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rockport, or 17 miles south of Richardson Grove State Park, moving northeast at 15 mph. A second strong storm will track behind it from the ocean. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Leggett and Rockport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
